be.uclouvain.mlg.jForest.splitting.split

Class UnivariateSplit

  • java.lang.Object
    • be.uclouvain.mlg.jForest.splitting.split.UnivariateSplit
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CategoricalBinarySplit, ContinuousBinarySplit

    public abstract class UnivariateSplit
extends java.lang.Object
    An instance of this class is used in each node to stock the splitting information i.e. the rule to classify new samples and the value of the metric optimized while training (e.g. gini).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UnivariateSplit(int var, double index)
      Initializes a univariate split on variable var which yielded a value of index

    • Constructor Detail

      • UnivariateSplit

        public UnivariateSplit(int var,
               double index)
        Initializes a univariate split on variable var which yielded a value of index
        Parameters:
        var - the column index of the variable in the full dataset
        index - the value of the metric optimized by the split (e.g. Gini)

    • Method Detail

      • getChildIdFor

        public abstract int getChildIdFor(double[] x)
        Computes in which child node an instance falls into
        Parameters:
        x - a p-dimensional sample to percolate down to a child node
        Returns:
        the index in [0 ; this.getNbChildren()[ of the child in which the training sample falls into

      • getChildIdFor

        public abstract int getChildIdFor(double v)
        Computes in which child node an instance falls into according the value of the feature of interest
        Parameters:
        v - the value of feature var (see constructor) of a sample to percolate down to a child node
        Returns:
        the index in [0 ; this.getNbChildren()[ of the child in which the training sample falls into
